product_name: Living ProofPerfect Hair Day (PhD) 5-in-1 Styling Treatment
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackStyle and treat in one simple step. Living Proof Perfect hair Day (PhD) 5-in-1 Styling Treatment is made to smooth, volumize, condition, strengthen and polish.
details: DetailsBenefitsDelivers 5 benefits in 1 stepCreates a style with volume and smoothnessConditions, strengthens and adds shineProvides heat protection (up to 450 F/230 C)Provides UV protectionFor most hair typesSafe for color and chemically treated hairFree of silicones, SLES and SLS, phthalates and glutenKey IngredientsThickening Molecule: Deposits microscopic thickening dots between strands so hair looks and feels naturally fullerTucuma Butter: Conditions dry and damaged hairConditioning Styling Polymer: Provides thermal protection and soft, flexible hold to maintain your style even in high humidityHemisqualane: Helps to smooth the cuticle, leaving hair silky and shinyItem 2264843How To UseApply to damp hair. Blow dry.Blow dry with a round brush to enhance volume and bodyBlow dry with a flat brush to create a smooth, polished blowoutFinish with a flat iron for a sleek finishFinish with a curling iron for soft wavesIngredientsWater/Eau/Aqua, Myristyl Alcohol, C13-15 Alkane, Behentrimonium Methosulfate, Butylene Glycol, Maltodextrin/VP Copolymer, Behenyl/Stearyl Aminopropanediol Esters, Polyalkylaminoester-1, Oleyl Alcohol, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Myrica Pubescens Fruit Wax, Astrocaryum Murumuru Seed Butter, Polyquaternium-55, Lauryl Methyl Gluceth-10 Hydroxypropyldimonium Chloride, PPG-3 Benzyl Ether Ethylhexanoate, PPG-2 Myristyl Ether Propionate, Cetyl Alcohol, Oleth-10, Steareth-2, Steareth-10, Fragrance/Parfum, Caprylic Acid, Lauric Acid, Potassium Sorbate, Propanediol, Citronellol, Limonene, Citral, LinalooShipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Apply to damp hair. Blow dry.Blow dry with a round brush to enhance volume and bodyBlow dry with a flat brush to create a smooth, polished blowoutFinish with a flat iron for a sleek finishFinish with a curling iron for soft waves

reviews.headline: Works
reviews.comments: I love the product but expensive

reviews.headline: I would buy this again and again‚Ä¶ and have!
reviews.comments: I love this product! If you have fine, thin hair, and are looking for something to give you body and hold, this is your product. It does not leave your hair looking weighted down or frizzy. For my hair, I feel that this gives me better results than the LP thickening cream. But that's a great option as well.

reviews.headline: This is my favorite styling product!
reviews.comments: Gives my thin, straight hair volume, softness and control. I love it!

reviews.headline: Excellent air dry cream
reviews.comments: I have wavy hair that can frizz. I use this as an air dry cream. I apply it to fairly wet, lightly towel dried hair. It makes my waves look styled like beach waves, but better. It adds a lot of volume to each hair, which I need. The style stays until shampooed out every four days. It doesn't make my hair greasy or dirty.  It's been my favorite styling product for at least seven years.

reviews.headline: My favorite hair product
reviews.comments: It gives my hair some thickness, and when I blow dry my hair with round brushes it helps my hair hold the styling.  As and added benefit, my second day hair looks fabulous!  No need to wash my hair on day 2.

reviews.headline: too heavy for my fine hair
reviews.comments: this made my fine hair feel heavy and full of waxy buildup

reviews.headline: I keep going back to this product after trying others
reviews.comments: I have tried several other products, but keep going back to the Perfect Hair Day line.  It is expensive, but worth paying for.  I air-dry my hair and this seems to work the best to control frizz.

reviews.headline: Really nice product
reviews.comments: I purchased this product in hopes of replacing a Redken product that I absolutely loved and was sadly discontinued (Aerate 08 - a bodifying cream-mousse).  I have been using this PHD product for about 3 weeks now and so far, so good.  You don't need a lot of product (at least on my chin length hair) and it controls my hair leaving it soft and protected from the heat of drying & straightening.  I would recommend it!

reviews.headline: Have purchased several times.
reviews.comments: Works for my hair. My hair is very fine and curly and needs lots of help.

reviews.headline: Does nothing
reviews.comments: I didn't notice any extra body or shine.

reviews.headline: So far, so good
reviews.comments: I have been using this for a couple of weeks now to try and add some protection for by breaking color treated hair. it does not leave my hair sticky or weighed down like some products. The smell is pleasant.

reviews.headline: I LOVE this product
reviews.comments: I got a free sample of this product and got 100% hooked. It adds volume to my hair but it leaves it light weight and silky, it also holds the style. I came back to purchase the full size. Smells good.

reviews.headline: I enjoy this products Love this!!
reviews.comments: Best !  Keep my hair looking beautiful all day!! I have bought this for several years and it's amazing. üå∫üå∑üå∫üå∑üå∫In the morning put just alittle through my hair and i'm good to go!!

reviews.headline: I love this product!
reviews.comments: I love this product.  Have used it for quite a while now.

reviews.headline: I love the product. Makes hair so smooth, silky and volumize
reviews.comments: Great product

reviews.headline: It's okay
reviews.comments: Its pretty okay. Im not a fan of the smell, it has a chemical citrus scent, however the product itselt is nice. I applied on damp hair and blowdried it, my hair was shiny and soft. Did manage my frizz. I would not buy it again though as theres other less expensive products for the same or better results

reviews.headline: Keep Coming Back to This
reviews.comments:
I have been using PHD on and off again for the last 5 years.  I love trying new products, but I always seem to come back to this when I want to simplify my styling regime and get out of the bathroom.  
A little goes a long way.  If you use too much it will cause your hair to feel a little gummy.  
Apply baby powder or dry shampoo and then do less next time.  
When you find the perfect amount it is like magic.  I always get compliments when I go back.  You would think I'd have learned by now - to stop straying.  :)

reviews.headline: Miracle Worker
reviews.comments: I'd been using a popular bonding styling cream for several months and my hair got frizzier everytime I used it, so I've returned to my old favorite tried and true PHD 5 in 1 styling cream. And no frizz and perfect hair. I neither blow dry nor style my hair. This cream does a miracle and makes my hair look great. However, while I don't mind the scent of this product, I do think it's a bit strong.

reviews.headline: Hair Feels Dry and Gross
reviews.comments: I don't love this product. I only used a little bit as directed. My hair felt so dried out and tangly from using this cream. It also made my hair feel dirty and gross. I can't relate to any of the positive reviews.

reviews.headline: I would buy this again.
reviews.comments: Help with frizz from humidity.

media.headline: I love this and the smell!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
media.caption: Here is the little sample from my ipsy bag.

faceoff_positive.comments: I had a sample tube of this and have now bought a full size bottle. It makes my fine, frizzy hair soft and shiny. I even got a compliment the other day on how beautiful and shiny my hair was - that hasn't happened in a long time! It also cuts blow drying time, which I love. The only pseudo-negative thing I would say is that I wouldn't use this if you need some structure to your style. It makes your hair very soft, so it won't hold a certain shape if you're trying to accomplish that. I typically just blow dry and flat iron my hair with a slight bend on the ends and it works great for that type of style.
faceoff_positive.headline: Love it!

faceoff_negative.comments: Not sure yet, but I am pretty sure I spent almost $30 for a product that is at best ...okay.  It does fill in my scraggly ends a bit, but so did my Pureology split end mender,  I'll have to give the product more of a chance.  It doesn't weigh my hair down, smells nice, but my hair is just as smooth, frizzy and flat as before.  I don't think it's some miracle product, which, is not surprising but is still disappointing. For now, I can't recommend this strictly due to price outweighing the results.
faceoff_negative.headline: On the fence
